comments.body: Do you want to the container not to be started if "storage" specified, meaning "storage" and "stareted" are mutually exclusive? Can you explain if there is any dependency?
thinking more of it, there is no reason why they are mutually exclusive, I've changed it to handle 'started' when state is 'present' or 'latest'.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +137,141 @@                changed = "Unable to find" not in out
                module.exit_json(msg=out, changed=changed)
        return

    if state == 'present' or state == 'latest':

comments.body: What happens when run called for a image which is already running, what will be result (changed)?
`changed` will be False.  `changed` is True only when a new image was pulled (either to Docker or to OSTree)
I am just thinking is there any way to merge with backend and without backend? There are few command differences, but is it possible to modify so that we can merge?

from what I can see the two branches are using different commands, e.g. /atomic pull/atomic run/atomic images delete/ and /atomic update/atomic run/atomic install/atomic uninstall/.  The only one in common seems to be "atomic run".  I am afraid it will be more difficult to merge the two cases
